required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Scandinavian Olecranon Research in the Elderly
clinical_study.official_title: SCORE Trial - Scandinavian Olecranon Research in the Elderly

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to study the difference between operative treatment, either with tension band wiring or plate fixation, and conservative treatment of traumatic, displaced olecranon fractures in elderly population in a non-inferiority study setting.

primary_outcome.measure: the Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)
primary_outcome.description: Minimum value 0, maximum value 100. Higher scores mean worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: the Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH)
secondary_outcome.description: Minimum value 0, maximum value 100. Higher scores mean worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Rated Elbow Evaluation (PREE) Finnish, Swedish and Danish versions
secondary_outcome.description: Minimum value 0, maximum value 100. Higher score indicates more pain and functional disability.
Minimum value 0, maximum value 10. Higher scores mean worse outcome ie. more pain.
Minimum value 0, maximum value 10. Higher scores mean worse outcome ie. less satisfactory situation.
The results are reported in degrees. Measurement is performed to the injured arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of extension strength between injured and healthy elbow.
secondary_outcome.description: Both arms are measured elbow flexed 60 and 90 degrees. Power is reported in grams. Measurements are performed in sitting position, back straight.

arm_group.description: tension band wiring or plate fixation

intervention.intervention_name: Tension band wiring or plate fixation
intervention.description: Operative fixation of olecranon fracture with either of the methods mentioned in the intervention name
Non-operative treatment and progressive range of motion as tolerated. A long-arm plaster will be used, if necessary, for pain relief.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Radiologically (standard AP and lateral radiographs) confirmed, displaced (≥2mm dislocation of the joint surface) fracture of the olecranon
- Age of patient is 75 years or over at the time of the injury
Exclusion Criteria:
- A delay more than 2 weeks after traumatic event to the day of intervention
- Mayo type 3 fracture
- Fracture continuation distal to coronoideus
- Other acute fracture or nerve damage of the ipsilateral upper limb
- Old fracture (<6 months) or pseudoarthrosis or unhealed nerve injury of the ipsilateral upper limb
- Open fracture
- Pathological fracture
- History of alcoholism, drug abuse, psychological or other emotional problems likely to jeopardize informed consent
- Patient's inability to understand written and spoken Finnish or Swedish or Danish
- Patient's denial for participation or cognitive incapability to provide consent
- Patient physically unfit for surgery
